channel.title: Environment :: CIS 526 Textbook
channel.description: Environment Variables As discussed earlier, an environment variable is a value present in memory in the operating system environment where a process is running. They contain important information about the system where the application is running, but they can also be configured by the user or system administrator to provide information and configuration to any processes running in that environment. This is especially used when working with containers like the dev container we built for this project.
